description: From Middle English nute, note, from Old English hnutu, from Proto-West Germanic *hnut, from Proto-Germanic *hnuts (“nut”) (compare West Frisian nút, Dutch noot, German Nuss, Danish nød, Swedish nöt, Norwegian nøtt), from Proto-Indo-European *knew- (compare Irish cnó, Latin nux (“walnut”)).

definitionGroups.group: (food, broadly) Any of various hard-shelled seeds or hard, dry fruits from various families of plants.

entries.meaning: (botany, strictly) Such a fruit that is indehiscent.

(hardware) A piece of hardware, typically metal and typically hexagonal or square in shape, with a hole through it having internal screw threads, intended to be screwed onto a threaded bolt or other threaded shaft.
examples: Hyponyms: acorn nut, barrel nut, square nut, wing nut, wingnut, T-nut

entries.meaning: (slang) The head. [from 19th c.]
(slang) A crazy person.
examples: Synonyms: loony, nutbag, nutcase, nutter; see also Thesaurus:mad person
He was driving his car like a nut.

entries.meaning: (colloquial) An extreme enthusiast.
examples: a fashion nut — a gun nut — a sailing nut

entries.meaning: (UK, slang, dated) An extravagantly fashionable young man. [1910s–1920s]
examples: ‘You are not going to be what they call a Nut, are you?’ she inquired with some anxiety, partly with the idea that a Nut would be an extravagance which her sister's small household would scarcely be justified in incurring [...].

entries.meaning: (anatomy, archaic) The glans (structure at the extremity of the penis or of the clitoris).
(vulgar, slang, chiefly plural) A testicle.
examples: I kicked him in the nuts.

entries.meaning: (vulgar, slang, uncountable) Semen, ejaculate.
(vulgar, slang, countable) Orgasm, ejaculation; especially release of semen.
examples: He just needs a good nut to make him feel better.

entries.meaning: (US, slang) Monthly expense to keep a venture running.
(US, slang) The amount of money necessary to set up some venture; set-up costs.
examples: My attorney was waiting in a bar around the corner. “This won't make the nut,” he said, “unless we have unlimited credit.”

entries.meaning: (US, slang) A stash of money owned by an extremely rich investor, sufficient to sustain a high level of consumption if all other money is lost.

(music, lutherie) On stringed instruments such as guitars and violins, the small piece at the peghead end of the fingerboard that holds the strings at the proper spacing and, in most cases, the proper height.
(typography slang) En, a unit of measurement equal to half of the height of the type in use.
(climbing) A shaped piece of metal, threaded by a wire loop, which is jammed in a crack in the rockface and used to protect a climb. (Originally, machine nuts [sense #2] were used for this purpose.)
examples: When placing nuts, always look for constrictions within the crack, behind which the nut can be wedged.

entries.meaning: (poker, only in attributive use) The best possible hand of a certain type, for instance: nut straight, nut flush, and nut full house. Compare nuts (“the best possible hand available”).
(firearms) The tumbler of a gunlock.
(nautical) A projection on each side of the shank of an anchor, to secure the stock in place.
(archaic) A small rounded cake or cookie.

verbs.description: nut (third-person singular simple present nuts, present participle nutting, simple past and past participle nutted or (nonstandard) nut)

entries.meaning: (mostly in the form "nutting") To gather nuts.
(UK, transitive, slang) To hit deliberately with the head; to headbutt.
examples: Synonyms: butt, Glasgow kiss, Liverpool kiss, loaf

entries.meaning: (slang, mildly vulgar) To orgasm; to ejaculate.
examples: Synonyms: blow a nut, bust a nut; see also Thesaurus:ejaculate

entries.meaning: (slang) To hit in the testicles.
(slang) To defeat thoroughly.
Alternative form of nuth (“Indian nose ring”)
